6.7  SERVICE STANDARDS. i-Escrow will comply with
all laws and regulations and act as an Independent Escrow
Agent as per the guidelines of California Escrow Law
(California Financial Code Section17000 et seq., or its
successor).  Should any of the terms, conditions or
provisions of this Agreement conflict with the California
Escrow Law, its rules or regulations, which govern
i-Escrow's business practices, the California
Escrow Law shall prevail. Notwithstanding the
foregoing, at any time that i-Escrow reasonably believes
such a conflict exists, i-Escrow will give 2TheMart
written notice of such conflict and the parties
will use their best efforts to resolve such conflict.
perturbation.changed_text: 6.7  SERVICE STANDARDS. i-Escrow will use reasonable efforts to comply with all laws and regulations. Should any of the terms, conditions or provisions of this Agreement conflict with any law, rule or regulation, i-Escrow will give 2TheMart written notice of such conflict and the parties will use their best efforts to resolve such conflict.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause explicitly states compliance with California Escrow Law and dictates that this law prevails in case of conflict. The modified clause removes the explicit reference to California Escrow Law, replacing it with a weaker commitment to 'reasonable efforts' and removing the provision that California Escrow Law shall prevail. This creates a legal loophole, potentially allowing i-Escrow to operate in a manner that doesn't fully adhere to the mandatory requirements of California Escrow Law, thereby omitting a legally mandated consumer protection.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Financial Code Section 17000 et seq.

perturbation.original_text:
9. INDEMNITY.  Each party (the "Indemnifying Party") shall
indemnify the other party (the "Indemnified Party")
against any and all claims, losses, costs and expenses,
including reasonable attorneys' fees, which the Indemnified
Party may incur as a result of claims in any form
by third parties arising from the Indemnifying Party's
acts, omissions or misrepresentations to the extent that the
Indemnified Party is deemed a principal of the Indemnifying
Party.  In addition, 2TheMart shall indemnify i-Escrow against
any and all claims, losses, costs and expenses, including
reasonable attorneys' fees, which i-Escrow may incur as a result
of claims in any form by third parties arising from 2TheMart
Content.  In addition, i-Escrow shall indemnify 2TheMart against
any and all claims, losses, costs and expenses, including
reasonable attorneys' fees, which 2TheMart may incur as a result
of claims in any form by third parties arising from i-Escrow
Content and or the Services provided to Customers.  The
foregoing obligations are conditioned on the Indemnified Party:
(i) giving the Indemnifying Party notice of the relevant
claim, (ii) cooperating with the Indemnifying Party, at the
Indemnifying Party's expense, in the defense of such
claim, and (iii) giving the Indemnifying Party the right to
control the defense and settlement of any such claim, except
that the Indemnifying Party shall not enter into any
settlement that affects the Indemnified Party's rights or
interest without the Indemnified Party's prior written approval.
The Indemnified Party shall have the right to participate
in the defense at its expense.
perturbation.changed_text: 9. INDEMNITY.  Each party (the "Indemnifying Party") shall reasonably endeavor to indemnify the other party (the "Indemnified Party") against claims, losses, costs and expenses which the Indemnified Party may incur as a result of claims by third parties arising from the Indemnifying Party's acts, omissions or misrepresentations. The foregoing obligations are conditioned on the Indemnified Party: (i) giving the Indemnifying Party notice of the relevant claim, (ii) cooperating with the Indemnifying Party in the defense of such claim, and (iii) giving the Indemnifying Party the right to control the defense and settlement of any such claim.
perturbation.explanation: The modification weakens the indemnity clause by replacing 'shall indemnify against any and all claims, losses, costs and expenses, including reasonable attorneys' fees' with 'shall reasonably endeavor to indemnify... against claims, losses, costs and expenses'. Removing 'any and all' and 'including reasonable attorneys' fees' limits the scope of indemnity, potentially violating California law which mandates comprehensive indemnity in certain commercial contracts. The removal of specific indemnities for content-related claims further weakens consumer protections.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Civil Code Section 2778 (interpretation of indemnity agreements)

perturbation.original_text:
10. LIMITATION ON LIABILITY.  EXCEPT IN THE EVENT OF A
BREACH OF SECTION 11, NEITHER PARTY SHALL BE LIABLE FOR SPECIAL,
INCIDENTAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES OR LOST PROFITS
(HOWEVER ARISING, INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE) ARISING OUT OF OR IN
CONNECTION WITH THIS AGREEMENT, EVEN IF THE PARTIES ARE
AWARE OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES.
perturbation.changed_text: 10. LIMITATION ON LIABILITY.  NEITHER PARTY SHALL BE LIABLE FOR INCIDENTAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES OR LOST PROFITS ARISING OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THIS AGREEMENT.
perturbation.explanation: This change removes the phrase '(HOWEVER ARISING, INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE)' from the limitation of liability clause. While parties can limit liability, removing the explicit exclusion of liability for damages arising from negligence creates ambiguity. California law generally disallows limiting liability for gross negligence or willful misconduct. By omitting 'including negligence', the contract could be interpreted to attempt to limit liability even for acts of simple negligence, which could be deemed unconscionable and violate public policy.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Civil Code Section 1668 (contracts contrary to public policy)
